managers

Class JobManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • managers.JobManager

  • public class JobManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The job manager will deal with holding all the jobs in the system and adding and removing any jobs that are needed
    Author:
    Kevin Silvera

      Will initialize the Job Manager

      • addJob

        public void addJob(java.lang.String jobID,
                   java.lang.String jobTitle,
                   java.lang.String jobType,
                   java.lang.String salary,
                   java.lang.String jobDescription,
                   java.lang.String expirationDate,
                   java.lang.String contactEmail)
        Will add a job into the arrayList of the job
        Parameters:
        jobID - will hold the job's identification
        jobTitle - will hold job's name
        jobType - will hold the classification
        salary - will hold the salary for the job
        jobDescription - the unique description for this job
        expirationDate - the date that will expire the job
        contactEmail - will hold the employer email

      • removeJob

        Will remove a job from the arrayList
        Parameters:
        jobID - will be used to check for the jobID in the ArrayList
        Returns:
        the JobID that was removed

                         java.lang.String salary,

                         java.lang.String expirationDate,
                         java.lang.String contactEmail)
        Will search for the job then will add the modified job in the ArrayList
        Parameters:
        jobID - will hold the job's identification
        jobTitle - will hold job's name
        jobType - will hold the classification
        salary - will hold the salary for the job
        jobDescription - the unique description for this job
        expirationDate - the date that will expire the job
        contactEmail - will hold the employer email
        Returns:
        true if successfully edited
